head.title: July 16-22; Loan to Fight African AIDS

hedline.hl1: July 16-22; Loan to Fight African AIDS

block.p: The United States plans to lend up to $1 billion annually to sub-Saharan African nations where AIDS and H.I.V. afflict 25 million people. The American loans, which will carry commercial interest rates, can be used only to buy American-produced drugs, equipment or medical services. Officials expect Japan and Europe to make similar amounts available to support their medical exports.

The United States plans to lend up to $1 billion annually to sub-Saharan African nations where AIDS and H.I.V. afflict 25 million people. The American loans, which will carry commercial interest rates, can be used only to buy American-produced drugs, equipment or medical services. The effort was generally praised by charity groups and African nations, but some Clinton administration officials worried that the loans undermined efforts to arrange debt relief for the same countries.
